title:
Will Apple Inc (AAPL) Outperform the Rest of the Stocks in the Technology 
Sector?
text:
Apple Inc (AAPL) is around the middle of the Technology sector according to InvestorsObserver.

AAPL received an overall rating of 50, which means that it scores higher than 50% of stocks. Additionally, Apple Inc scored a 56 in the Technology sector, ranking it higher than 56% of stocks in that sector.





 AAPL has an Overall Score of 50. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on AAPL!
See Full AAPL Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Finding the best stocks can be tricky. It isn’t easy to compare companies across industries. Even companies in the technology sector can be tricky to compare sometimes. InvestorsObserver’s tools allow a top-down approach that lets you pick a metric, find the top sector and industry and then find the best stocks in that sector. 

Our proprietary scoring system captures technical factors, fundamental analysis and the opinions of analysts on Wall Street. This makes InvestorsObserver’s overall rating a great way to get started, regardless of your investing style. 

Percentile-ranked scores are also easy to understand. A score of 100 is the top and a 0 is the bottom. There’s no need to try to remember what is “good” for a bunch of complicated ratios, just pay attention to which numbers are the highest. 



What's Happening With Apple Inc Stock Today?

Apple Inc (AAPL) stock has risen 0.66% while the S&P 500 is lower by -0.05% as of 11:17 AM on Tuesday, Mar 19. AAPL has gained $1.14 from the previous closing price of $173.72 on volume of 15,572,493 shares. Over the past year the S&P 500 is higher by 30.24% while AAPL has gained 11.09%. AAPL earned $6.43 a per share in the over the last 12 months, giving it a price-to-earnings ratio of 27.21.
